result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan M Mcdonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total costs to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to submit to random testing.  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No illegal drugs.   Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment. Defendant to submit DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.
-2- days credit, if revoked.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Must be employed at least 40 hours per week.
Run a 5K, 10K, 1/2 Marathon, and a Marathon while on supervision. Defendant to report to agent.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan M Mcdonald

records.addlTxt: Sentencing After Revo / 09-20-2017

Defendant Dylan M Mcdonald in court with attorney Justin Padway.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation. Counsel addresses court. Defendant addresses court. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing Memorandum.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk.
Copies forwarded to Corporal Gahan
Defendant transferring to Dodge Correctional therefore State will need to prepare an Order to Produce. Clerk notified the State by email.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Boaz present in court. Atty Shannon Whitworth in court for the State. Counsel requests an adjournment as defendant has not been appointed counsel. No objections by the State. Sentencing after revocation adjourned to September 20, 2017 at 1:30 pm.
Controller confirmed balance due with DOC Cashier, defendant has not made any payments, owes costs of $518.00.
Notice of Hearing sent to Dylan McDonald returned.
Two certified copies provided to court services.
to Produce
